paper_abstract: Given a set of points S in any dimension, we describe a deterministic algorithm for finding a T subset of S, vertical bar T vertical bar = O(1/epsilon) such that the centroid of T approximates the centroid of S within a factor 1 + epsilon for any fixed epsilon > 0. We achieve this in linear time by an efficient derandomization of the algorithm in [M. Inaba, N. Katoh, H. Imai, Applications of weighted Voronoi diagrams and randomization to variance-based k-clustering (extended abstract), in: Proceedings of the Tenth Annual Symposium on Computational Geometry, 1994,pp.332-339]. paper_title: A linear time deterministic algorithm to find a small subset that approximates the centroid
